recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Paanpole is a famous well known breakfast item among every household in Konkanis. It is a simple paper thin rice crepe that does not require any fermentation. It is also known as Neer Dosa in other parts of Karnataka.
The batter has a milk like consistency and it is enjoyed with spicy chutneys and with non veg curries as well.

procedureSteps.stepDescription: Soak the rice for 4-6 hours. You can keep it overnight as well. Make a fine paste in grinder along with sooji. Rub a little batter in between your fingers, it should not be grainy. If it is, grind it again till you get a fine paste. Add water till you reach milk like consistency. Add salt. Mix it well. The batter is ready.

Generally Paanpole is made on an iron skillet, but if you don't have one, use non-stick pan. Heat the skillet or pan. Grease it with oil. Before pouring batter, always make sure to mix the batter, because rice has a tendency to settle down. Pour the batter evenly on the pan, and cover it immediately with a lid so that the moisture doesn't get lost.

Cook it for a minute. Remove the lid, wait for 30 secs and flip it and let the other side cook for 1 min. Keep it aside on a plate. One thing to remember is always place paanpole on top of each other when its cool down, hot ones tend to stick.

tips.tipDesc: If you are a non-vegetarian, you can also add one egg instead if sooji while grinding. Even an egg helps preventing the batter from sticking to the pan.
The batter can be stored in refrigerator. But while using it to make fresh paanpole, the batter should be at room temperature.
